TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IXsltContextVariable

Docs.summary: Provides an interface to a given variable that is defined in the style sheet during runtime execution.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information on using IXsltContextVariable , see article Q324899, "HOW TO: Implement and Use Custom Functions When You Execute XPath Queries in Visual Basic .NET" in the Microsoft Knowledge Base at http://support.microsoft.com.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Evaluate(class System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext xsltContext) cil managed

Docs.param: An representing the execution context of the variable.
Docs.summary: Evaluates the variable at runtime and returns an object that represents the value of the variable.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Object> representing the value of the variable. Possible return types include number, string, Boolean, document fragment, or node set.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the variable is local.
Docs.value: if the variable is a local variable in the current context; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the variable is an Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT) parameter. This can be a parameter to a style sheet or a template.
Docs.value: if the variable is an XSLT parameter; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the representing the XML Path Language (XPath) type of the variable.
Docs.value: The representing the XPath type of the variable.
